msItem.title: Medical treatise and extracts
msItem.note: (consilia extracted from Antonius Cermisonus (in particular), Bartholomaeus Montagna, and others)
msItem.incipit: Contra cronicum dolorem capitis per essentiam, et colligamus ex vaporibus ex stomacho
msItem.explicit: omnia dicta medicamina bulire faciat in vino nigro stiptico decoctionis mirabole Indorum, que sunt pro locione vel locionibus: An. Cer. Deo Gratias.
msItem.finalRubric: Et in hoc terminantur letitiora concilia excellentissimi ac famosissimi arcium et medicine doctoris M. An. Cer. ad laudem Omnipotentis Dei ejusque Virginis et matris Marie totiusque curie celestis triumphantis, Amen. Deo gracias, semper
msItem.note: eTK 0260K, citing another copy in Paris, Bibliothèque Nationale, Latin 1395

msItem.rubric: Sequuntur hic aliqui canones curationem. servandi in administratione medicinarum, qui canones summus medicine professor dominus M. Anthonius Cermisonus Patavinus

msItem.author: Guillelmus de Varignana
msItem.title: Practica
msItem.rubric: Incipiunt nucleata ex Practica Guilhelmi de Varingana super singulis membrorum dispositionibus, etc

msItem.author: Bernard de Gordon
msItem.title: Lilium medicinae
msItem.rubric: Sequuntur hic diffinitiones egritudinum singulorum membrorum tocius corporis secundum Liliatorem, alias Gordonium
msItem.incipit: Primus de febribus. Febris est calor innaturalis in igneum mutatus, etc. Effimera est febris ex distemperacia
msItem.finalRubric: Expliciunt hic diffinitiones egritudinum ipsius Gordonii Liliatoris, etc. Deo gratias

msItem.author: Petrus de Argellata
msItem.title: Cirurgia
msItem.rubric: Incipit liber quartus de decoratione omnium membrorum corporis humani
msItem.incipit: Omnipotens Christus, qui existens immobilis cuncta commovet in homine
De denigracione capillorum. Capillus sumit generacionem a fumosa materia
msItem.explicit: et ad correctionem omnium et supportacionem meorum sociorum. Amen
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit liber quartus de decoratione humani corporis a capite usque ad pedes. Amen
msItem.colophon: Finis adest vere laudatur qui est sine fine. Per me Joh. Lampis quinta die Januarii in profesto Epiphanie, anno 1461
msItem.bibl: eTK 0187G, apparently misidentified, taking the scribe's name as an author. Both incipits correspond to bk. 5 of Petrus de Argellata as pr. Venice, 1492 (GW 2322).

msItem.author: Avicenna
msItem.title: De uiribus cordis
msItem.incipit: Creavit Deus ex concavitatibus cordis ut esset armarium Spiritus
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit liber A vicenne de viribus et medicinis cordis translatus a magistro Arnoldo, marchione de Villa Nova

msItem.author: Petrus Hispanus
msItem.title: Thesaurus pauperum
msItem.explicit: (de anthrace) inter duos lapides diuino miraculo sanat ancracem. Explicit

msItem.author: Galeatius de Sancta Sophia
msItem.title: De simplicibus
msItem.incipit: Abrotanum calidum et siccum in iio. In comfortacione stomachi frigidi valet
msItem.finalRubric: Expliciunt simplicia Galeacii de Sancta Sophia sub compendio extracta; Laus Omnipotenti Gubernatori

history.provenance: Colophon, art. 5; not in Watson, Dated and Datable.
Perhaps in England in the 15th century: medical recipe in an English hand, fol. 341v.
history.acquisition: Part of his first donation to the Bodleian, 1635

recordHist.source: Description adapted (May 2021) from the Quarto Catalogue (H. O. Coxe, Laudian Manuscripts, Quarto Catalogues II, repr. with corrections, 1969, from the original ed. of 1858–1885), with additional reference to published literature as cited. Quarto Catalogue, col. 444 Quarto Catalogue, col. 445 Quarto Catalogue, p. 574 Summary Catalogue, vol. 2, part 1, p. 37

revisionDesc.change: Description revised to include all information in Quarto Catalogue.
James Cummings Up-converted the markup using https://github.com/jamescummings/Bodleian-msDesc-ODD/blob/master/convertTolkien2Bodley.xsl
